content.description:
This climb shares the first three bolts with Strange Rover, to it’s left for now. Start on the left/downhill side of Punk Rock and climb a crimpy crux past the first bolt to a rest before sorting out the next hard sequence to the third bolt. Then head right and follow the line of bolts over several small roofs, where the climbing is tricky but super awesome. After the sixth bolt the climbing eases slightly, as you climb past several ledge sections. It’s still challenging  and super cool, using some meat hooks and underclings, and ending in a mantle to the anchors.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=12kcpP-8jfM



The middle line on Punk Rock, sharing the first three bolts with Strange Rover.

10 bolts and chain anchors.

The rightmost climb on Punk Rock starts with a pretty stiff boulder problem off the ground and finishes with some really amazing moves, with good climbing in between. Recommend stick clipping the second if you can reach it.
Navigate the first .11 crux off the ground and carefully get on your feet above the first bolt and clip the second bolt on the slab, then continue past some blocky terrain and onto the slightly overhanging headwall above. Super interesting and fairly difficult climbing in the middle section leads to some awesome moves past rounded cracks and corners at the top crux past the last three bolts (.11+ redpoint crux).
Classic, well protected, and really really fun!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HFFCKJiJVPE



The furthest right climb on Punk Rock. Follow the Walmart cliffs all the way to the upper end.

8 bolts and chain anchors.

Strange Rover starts in the left corner of Punk Rock with a crimpy boulder problem at the first bolt(technical crux), then climbs past tricky climbing to the third bolt. Go left here and climb near the left corner , where you get a little break on easier slab terrain. Then navigate a small overlap and clip the fifth bolt before turning the left corner and stemming across the gap. Take a rest and sort out the next sequence, that isn’t so bad once you figure out how to pull back onto the wall. You will feel like you are too far left of the fifth bolt until you pull on and commit to the moves that aren’t so hard as they are scary. The final three bolts follow great climbing bringing you back onto the front face and ending with a hard mantle at the chains.
Varied and really interesting. Named after a punk/metal band from Oregon, who the developer drew a raven logo for..and for the raven’s nest to your left as you climb the upper half of this wandering climb. Heads up, the mantle at the end might get ya!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1KkD8C8XFrw



Starts at the lower/left end of Punk Rock. Shares the first three bolts with the climb to its right. 

8 bolts and chain anchors.

This interesting wall sits at the upper end of the area and is marked by several overlapping roofs on orange and gray rock. There are three climbs here. All three climbs start with hard boulder problems to technical slabs that then give way to overlapping roofs. Challenging and cryptic climbing awaits.
It is possible to set up towrope anchors on all three of these climbs, but be careful accessing the chains. You may want to use the large tree behind the wall as a quick anchor to do so.
